intro: Quararibea floribunda, commonly known as the yellow bell tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters, with smooth, greyish bark and opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract various pollinators such as bees and birds.
